match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 6 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)

image.caption: A general view of the redeveloped R Premadasa Stadium
image.longCaption: A general view of the redeveloped R Premadasa Stadium, Basnahira v Wayamba, SLC Inter-provisional limited-over tournament, Colombo, 23 January 2011

match.hoursInfo: 10.00 start, First Session 10.00-13.30 Interval 13.30-14.15, Second Session 14.15-17.45

dismissalText.long: c MDKJ Perera b BAW Mendis
dismissalText.commentary: James Taylor c MDKJ Perera b BAW Mendis 90 (109b 6x4 2x6 150m) SR: 82.56

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket, aiming over the off side, gets it off the toe and squirts it to cover! A shame for Taylor who's missed out on a century on his return to the side but he's played very nicely indeed. Aiming over the off side here, trying to play in-to-out, didn't get it quite right, it looped to where cover was shuffling back and claimed an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 62 (47b 4x4 3x6 59m) SR: 131.91

dismissalComment.html: slog swept again but Morgan hasn't got this at all, it's gone straight up and Sangakkara runs out to take the catch. Good work from the keeper to run up the wicket to take that because it went a long way up

stays leg side of this again, goes to drive again and gets bowled! The change works for Sri Lanka, Herath has struck with perhaps a quicker ball that Root has misjudged. He should have been playing much straighter but tried to slash it square and missed, losing his middle and off stumps, partnership broken

down the wicket, goes in the air down the ground and picks out long-on. No where near enough club on that, bit of an inside edge and it was a straightforward chance to Jaywardene running a few yards to his left. A big wicket for Sri Lanka who have kept things very quiet since the batting Powerplay

a very slow loopy delivery that Woakes tries to slap into the leg side and he's bowled, missing it by a mile really. Couldn't pick up the pace of the delivery, swung right across it and got cleaned up, Woakes has really struggled with spin this tour

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket, aiming over the off side, gets it off the toe and squirts it to cover! A shame for Taylor who's missed out on a century on his return to the side but he's played very nicely indeed. Aiming over the off side here, trying to play in-to-out, didn't get it quite right, it looped to where cover was shuffling back and claimed an easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: swept up into the leg side but gets it too high and not long enough, the catch taken by deep square running to his right. A firm strike off a middle and leg line but the timing not quite there, it was a big top edge really, and another wicket falls

waited for and cut hard straight to backward point! Rocking back to try and force this away through the off side, Jordan is early on the stroke and chipped it straight to the fielder who gleefully claimed an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Alex Hales c Jayawardene b Prasad 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: big strike! Gets his line straighter, it's full outside off, Hales is tempted into having a drive and a thick outside flies at chest height to Jayawardene at slip

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 19 (20b 3x4 0x6 37m) SR: 95

dismissalComment.html: oh my! Moeen stepped out of his crease and had an almighty heave, he wasn't close to the pitch of the ball and it fell well short of him and spun away to beat the bat, the keeper had loads of time to make the stumping. Hang on, Sangakkara said there was an edge. Either way, that's out.

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root b Herath 36 (49b 1x4 1x6 77m) SR: 73.46

dismissalComment.html: stays leg side of this again, goes to drive again and gets bowled! The change works for Sri Lanka, Herath has struck with perhaps a quicker ball that Root has misjudged. He should have been playing much straighter but tried to slash it square and missed, losing his middle and off stumps, partnership broken

headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.long: c MDKJ Perera b BAW Mendis
dismissalText.commentary: James Taylor c MDKJ Perera b BAW Mendis 90 (109b 6x4 2x6 150m) SR: 82.56

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket, aiming over the off side, gets it off the toe and squirts it to cover! A shame for Taylor who's missed out on a century on his return to the side but he's played very nicely indeed. Aiming over the off side here, trying to play in-to-out, didn't get it quite right, it looped to where cover was shuffling back and claimed an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara b Dilshan 22 (31b 0x4 0x6 47m) SR: 70.96

dismissalComment.html: back looking to force down the ground and it's through him! Onto Bopara faster than he was anticipating and he's lost his middle and off stumps. Like Root, a total misjudgment really, he exposed his stumps and the delivery ran on and through his stroke, might have kept a touch low

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler c Jayawardene b Herath 15 (22b 0x4 1x6 21m) SR: 68.18

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket, goes in the air down the ground and picks out long-on. No where near enough club on that, bit of an inside edge and it was a straightforward chance to Jaywardene running a few yards to his left. A big wicket for Sri Lanka who have kept things very quiet since the batting Powerplay

dismissalText.long: c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis
dismissalText.commentary: Ben Stokes c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: swept up into the leg side but gets it too high and not long enough, the catch taken by deep square running to his right. A firm strike off a middle and leg line but the timing not quite there, it was a big top edge really, and another wicket falls

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Woakes b Herath 6 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: a very slow loopy delivery that Woakes tries to slap into the leg side and he's bowled, missing it by a mile really. Couldn't pick up the pace of the delivery, swung right across it and got cleaned up, Woakes has really struggled with spin this tour

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Jordan c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: waited for and cut hard straight to backward point! Rocking back to try and force this away through the off side, Jordan is early on the stroke and chipped it straight to the fielder who gleefully claimed an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 62 (47b 4x4 3x6 59m) SR: 131.91

dismissalComment.html: slog swept again but Morgan hasn't got this at all, it's gone straight up and Sangakkara runs out to take the catch. Good work from the keeper to run up the wicket to take that because it went a long way up

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Woakes b Jordan 86 (105b 7x4 0x6 165m) SR: 81.9

dismissalComment.html: oh goodness me. Long hop outside off and Sangakkara has belted it straight to deep cover! What a miserable way to go. Terrible delivery but Sangakkara has thrown the kitchen sink at it, pretty much nailed it too, only to perfectly pick out the off side scout who doesn't have to move in pouching the catch, game on?

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 51 (60b 5x4 0x6 103m) SR: 85

dismissalComment.html: tries to play through the covers and drags this on! A desperately needed breakthrough for England. A lazy drive aiming through the off side and gets a thick inside edge into the ground and into the off stump. A seemingly gentle length ball a foot and a half wide of off stump has done for Jayawardene and maybe there's some hope for England

oh goodness me. Long hop outside off and Sangakkara has belted it straight to deep cover! What a miserable way to go. Terrible delivery but Sangakkara has thrown the kitchen sink at it, pretty much nailed it too, only to perfectly pick out the off side scout who doesn't have to move in pouching the catch, game on?

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: floated up just outside off, driven and edged to slip! Perera can change his gloves again now, driving a touch loosely at a ball just wide enough to entice the drive, it's turned just enough to take a thick outside edge and Jordan has held a sharp chance at slip, well bowled Moeen

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Morgan b Woakes 16 (21b 3x4 0x6 24m) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: massive blow! They've snaffled Dilshan. It was a short-of-a-length delivery which Dilshan tried to carve it away over the covers but only succeeded in getting a top edge which looped into the off side, where Morgan back-tracked well from inside the circle

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Jordan b Ali 31 (41b 3x4 0x6 61m) SR: 75.6

dismissalComment.html: floated up just outside off, driven and edged to slip! Perera can change his gloves again now, driving a touch loosely at a ball just wide enough to entice the drive, it's turned just enough to take a thick outside edge and Jordan has held a sharp chance at slip, well bowled Moeen

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Jordan 44 (50b 4x4 0x6 73m) SR: 88

dismissalComment.html: tries to play through the covers and drags this on! A desperately needed breakthrough for England. A lazy drive aiming through the off side and gets a thick inside edge into the ground and into the off stump. A seemingly gentle length ball a foot and a half wide of off stump has done for Jayawardene and maybe there's some hope for England

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Woakes b Jordan 86 (105b 7x4 0x6 165m) SR: 81.9

dismissalComment.html: oh goodness me. Long hop outside off and Sangakkara has belted it straight to deep cover! What a miserable way to go. Terrible delivery but Sangakkara has thrown the kitchen sink at it, pretty much nailed it too, only to perfectly pick out the off side scout who doesn't have to move in pouching the catch, game on?

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full ball squeezed away on the leg side, of this is well time and Jordan has to scramble across from long-on...and can't get there!

commentPostTextItems.html: England have fought hard today but again come up short. The batting let them down. From a great position set for a total close to 300, via James Taylor's superb 90, they faltered in the Powerplay and a collapse saw them post a below-par total. Imagine what even an extra 10-15 runs would have done? It was a very good effort with the ball but wides - 12 of them - and a crucial dropped chance of Mathews have seen them come unstuck.

Cool cookie Angelo Mathews has steered his side home with a fine captain's knock, keeping his head when England managed to make the hosts sweat. Mathews has brought up his fifty and also brought victory by six wickets in an excellent contest that's gone right to the final over. Great entertainment for the best crowd of the series but it's Sri Lanka now 3-1 up in the series with a steady run chase. It looked to be more comfortable at one stage when Kumar Sangakkara was going strong but England fought back well to make a real game of it but in the end England were a few light with the bat.
alan: "A duck and a drop for Hales. Not a good day for the young man." I'll bring you the presentation shortly.

Eoin Morgan "We were good in patches, Taylor played outstandingly well. But in patches we weren't at the races. It's nice to get some runs under my belt, it will lift my confidence. If we'd got Mahela or Sanga earlier it would have opened up the middle order and given us a chance. It probably would have been nice to have another spinner."

Angelo Mathews "It was a good, close game. We had to fight hard. The spinners after the 35th over did brilliantly. I was a bit nervous at the end, but I knew we had wickets in hand. It was a good team effort."

Man of the Match is Kumar Sangakkara. "It wasn't ideal to get out at that time, but the match was well in hand. We just needed to rotate strike [with Mahela] and pick up a few boundaries. You will always back yourself to chase six an over in the last ten."
And that's that for today. Thanks for your company. We look forward to you joining us again for the next match in Pallekele.

commentTextItems.html: full ball, driven hard down the ground...only to mid-off. Absolutely no chance of a single. Thirimanne gets comfortably back into his ground

commentPostTextItems.html: Some pressure, this is good from Finn. 3 from 3 now...

commentTextItems.html: very full at the leg stump, Mathews unable to pierce the off side ring

commentPreTextItems.html: So England manage to take it deep and Finn to try and pull off something spectacular...

commentTextItems.html: around the wicket, swung into the leg side and it lands short of long-on steaming in, more fortune for the hosts, Thirimanne not in control of that stroke
big leg side swing, it's wide enough of deep midwicket for them to charge back for two

commentPostTextItems.html: They've never quite shrugged England off here Sri Lanka but have been generally in control and now just need four from the final set...

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: down the wicket, tried to be swung over the off side, Thirimanne gets it high on the bat but ever-so-luckily manages to chip it just over the head of short extra-cover and short of the onrushing mid-off, rum luck for England
Mathews backs away again, Woakes follows him, Mathews then manages to get inside the line and flicks to long leg
full at the leg stump, clipped down to long leg
down the wicket and drives hard through the off side, finds the gap wide of mid-off, nice stroke

commentPreTextItems.html: Just two to go but just 13 required. Woakes isn't going to bowl his full 10...

commentTextItems.html: length ball tried to be swung over the leg side, gets hit around the waist
very full, driven off low on the bat to mid-off

commentPostTextItems.html: Excellent spell from Jordan, the best he's sent down for a while...

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: tries to back away again but Jordan follows him and Mathews can only knock it back to the bowler
backs away to leg and drives a full ball past a diving extra cover, lovely stroke and just managed to pierce the packed off side field, just over and wide of James Taylor
full angled in, a swing to leg, a miss, a cry for lbw, surely going down, it runs off backward of point for a leg bye
around the wicket, back of a length outside off, goes to uppercut and misses
length at the body, tucked down to long leg
waits for this and tries to angle down to third man, plays and misses

commentPostTextItems.html: Under control for Sri Lanka but England just about still in the game. But surely their chance has come and gone with that Mathews chance...

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: back of a length, paddled around and down to long leg
back away again, Woakes follows him and cramps him up, this is just dabbed into midwicket
slower ball, gives himself a little room and cuts hard and gets it into the gap between point and cover, great shot, played one-handed in the end

headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis
dismissalText.commentary: Ben Stokes c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: swept up into the leg side but gets it too high and not long enough, the catch taken by deep square running to his right. A firm strike off a middle and leg line but the timing not quite there, it was a big top edge really, and another wicket falls

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Woakes b Herath 6 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: a very slow loopy delivery that Woakes tries to slap into the leg side and he's bowled, missing it by a mile really. Couldn't pick up the pace of the delivery, swung right across it and got cleaned up, Woakes has really struggled with spin this tour

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Jordan c NLTC Perera b BAW Mendis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: waited for and cut hard straight to backward point! Rocking back to try and force this away through the off side, Jordan is early on the stroke and chipped it straight to the fielder who gleefully claimed an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 62 (47b 4x4 3x6 59m) SR: 131.91

dismissalComment.html: slog swept again but Morgan hasn't got this at all, it's gone straight up and Sangakkara runs out to take the catch. Good work from the keeper to run up the wicket to take that because it went a long way up

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Morgan b Woakes 16 (21b 3x4 0x6 24m) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: massive blow! They've snaffled Dilshan. It was a short-of-a-length delivery which Dilshan tried to carve it away over the covers but only succeeded in getting a top edge which looped into the off side, where Morgan back-tracked well from inside the circle

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Jordan b Ali 31 (41b 3x4 0x6 61m) SR: 75.6

dismissalComment.html: floated up just outside off, driven and edged to slip! Perera can change his gloves again now, driving a touch loosely at a ball just wide enough to entice the drive, it's turned just enough to take a thick outside edge and Jordan has held a sharp chance at slip, well bowled Moeen

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Woakes b Jordan 86 (105b 7x4 0x6 165m) SR: 81.9

dismissalComment.html: oh goodness me. Long hop outside off and Sangakkara has belted it straight to deep cover! What a miserable way to go. Terrible delivery but Sangakkara has thrown the kitchen sink at it, pretty much nailed it too, only to perfectly pick out the off side scout who doesn't have to move in pouching the catch, game on?

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Jordan 44 (50b 4x4 0x6 73m) SR: 88

dismissalComment.html: tries to play through the covers and drags this on! A desperately needed breakthrough for England. A lazy drive aiming through the off side and gets a thick inside edge into the ground and into the off stump. A seemingly gentle length ball a foot and a half wide of off stump has done for Jayawardene and maybe there's some hope for England

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 51 (60b 5x4 0x6 103m) SR: 85

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15

stories.title: We missed Tredwell - Morgan
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: We missed James Tredwell - Eoin Morgan
stories.summary: England's decision to field Ben Stokes instead of James Tredwell may have contributed to them going 3-1 down in the series but they have accepted that there will be some collateral damage

image.caption: Ben Stokes endured a difficult evening with the ball
image.longCaption: Ben Stokes endured a difficult evening with the ball, Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, December 3, 2014

stories.title: Sri Lanka's spinners keep taking the tricks
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka's spinners keep taking the tricks
stories.summary: Sri Lanka's wonderfully inventive collection of spinners are combining to make up a winning hand against England, but their potential impact in the World Cup is harder to assess

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan picked up three wickets
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan picked up three wickets, Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, December 7, 2014

stories.title: Taylor leaves England grateful for small mercies
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: James Taylor leaves England grateful for small mercies
stories.summary: James Taylor's chance has been a long time coming, but he took it in style in Colombo to press his claims for a place in England's World Cup squad

stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo

stories.summary: Stats highlights from the fourth ODI between England and Sri Lanka at the R Premadasa Stadium, Colombo

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara was masterful in his 86
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara was masterful in his 86, Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, December 7, 2014

stories.title: Cool Mathews steers Sri Lanka home
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Cool Angelo Mathews steers Sri Lanka home
stories.summary: Sri Lanka regained their two-match advantage in the one-day series although were pushed closer than appeared likely for most of the chase before getting home with two balls to spare.

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara was masterful in his 86
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara was masterful in his 86, Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, December 7, 2014

stories.title: Buttler's timely intervention reinvigorates England
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Jos Buttler's timely intervention reinvigorates England
stories.summary: The prospects for England at the forthcoming World Cup have not been much of a conversation starter in recent times but they do have a few players who are starting to get people talking

image.caption: Jos Buttler pulled out his full range after England had stuttered
image.longCaption: Jos Buttler pulled out his full range after England had stuttered, Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, December 3, 2014

stories.title: SL aim to quell England revival
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: SL aim to quell England revival
stories.summary: If the scoreline had read 3-0 to Sri Lanka after Hambantota, the series would have started to lose its edge. Instead, at 2-1 there is now much to play for as the teams return to the capital

image.caption: Ajantha Mendis chats with Angelo Mathews
image.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis chats with Angelo Mathews, Colombo, December 6, 2014

videos.title: 'It was a challenging wicket' - Thirimanne
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
videos.summary: Sri Lanka vice-captain Lahiru Thirimanne was pleased his team grabbed victory in the fourth ODI in Colombo against England on a challenging wicket, adding his team were focused on winning the series.

videos.title: 'We're not down and out' - Morgan
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: 'We're not down and out' - Eoin Morgan
videos.summary: Stand-in captain Eoin Morgan praised the contribution of James Taylor in England's loss to Sri Lanka in Colombo whilst admitting he had regained some confidence after scoring 62

videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
videos.summary: Andrew Fernando reports from the fourth ODI between England and Sri Lanka where the home side claimed a six-wicket victory with two balls to spare
